chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant David S Brinn was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (7th, 8th or 9th), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incareration Program.
Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
Sentence credit of 48 days is granted.
04/21/22 PER REVIEW, SENTENCE CREDIT IS 47 DAYS

superMiscConds.notes: Fine to be paid as a condition of probation.

Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.  

Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Village of Menomonee Falls Police Department.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.

Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment, and/or counseling recommended by Agent. 
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol. 
Do not drive or operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license, comply with all licensing restrictions. 
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

supervisions.notes: 04/25/22 PER REVIEW, COURT MODIFIES EXTENDED SUPERVISION TO 5 YEARS.
Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

Perform alcohol assessment. 
Attend Victim Impact Panel in Waukesha County within 6 months of release from custody.

to the Court filed by the Department of Corrections requesting a review of the Judgment of Conviction and extended supervision time.

  **Reviewed by Judge Dorow on 04/22/22--The Court agrees that the maximum amount of Extended Supervision is five years. Therefore the total sentence is commuted to 11 years (6 Initial Confinement and 5 Extended Supervision). An amended Judgement of Conviction will be prepared.**
to the Court filed by the Department of Corrections requesting a review of the Judgment of Conviction and sentence credit.

Plea/sentencing hearing on March 4, 2022 at 11:00 am.

10:01 AM Defendant David S Brinn in court, in custody, with attorney Anna M Kees.   Chelsea Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense has received discovery and an offer. 
Defense requests a plea and sentencing date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 4, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Hearing on February 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.

09:38 AM Defendant David S Brinn in court, in custody, with attorney Anna M Kees.   Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  
Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.

The Court notes that a request for substitution was filed and has been approved, however a Judge has not been reassigned yet.
A notice of new court date will be sent to the Defendant. 
Bail remains as fixed.
